intro: Hylaeaicum mooreanum, commonly known as the Moorean hylaeaicum, is a rare and unique plant species native to the island of Sainte-Marie in the Seychelles. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in dense vegetation. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
